metadata.title: CVE-2019-11754 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When the pointer lock is enabled by a website though requestPointerLock(),no user notification is given. This could allow a malicious website tohijack the mouse pointer and confuse users. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 69.0.1.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
